info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser
Class ActiveArc<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>

java.lang.Object
  info.jonclark.treegraft.core.rules.DottedGrammarRule<R,T>
      info.jonclark.treegraft.chartparser.ActiveArc<R,T>
Type Parameters:
R - The rule type being used in this ChartParser
T - The token type being used in this ChartParser
public class ActiveArc<R extends GrammarRule<T>,T extends Token>
extends DottedGrammarRule<R,T>

Represents the current state of a DottedGrammarRule in the ChartParser. The collection of all current ActiveArcs is managed by the ActiveArcManager. In terms of theorm-proving, when an ActiveArc is completed, it means the constituent exists, and so it is then converted into a Key by the ChartParser and stored in the Chart.

Author:
Jonathan Clark

Field Detail

DEFAULT_BACKPOINTER_LIST_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_BACKPOINTER_LIST_SIZE
The initial list size for the backpointer lists. Increasing this value will take up more memory initially, but will reduce the amount of time spent growing the backpointer vectors if the number of backpointers created during parsing typically exceeds this number.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ActiveArc

public ActiveArc(int startIndex,
                 int endIndex,
                 int dot,
                 R rule)
Creates a new ActiveArc.

Parameters:
startIndex - The zero-based source input index where this arc begins.
endIndex - The zero-based source input index where this arc currently ends, given the dot position.
dot - The number of RHS consituents in this ActiveArc's rule that have been covered so far.
rule - The GrammarRule that called for the creation of this ActiveArc given the current state of the Chart.
Method Detail

extend

public ActiveArc<R,T> extend(Key<R,T> key)
Creates a new ActiveArc given a Key, which matches the next source-side RHS, which is needed by this ActiveArc.

Parameters:
key - A Key, whose source LHS should match the source-side RHS constituent directly to the right of the dot for this ActiveArc.
Returns:
A new ActiveArc with its dot moved one position to the right and with a backpointer to the given Key added.

addBackpointer

public void addBackpointer(int index,
                           Key<R,T> key)
Adds a backpointer to an existing Key this ActiveArc for the specified source-side RHS consituent so that we can later retrace these backpointers to create a parse tree or parse forest (hypergraph).

Parameters:
index - The zero-based index of the source-side RHS constituent that this backpointer references.
key - The Key that will be added as a backpointer.

getBackpointers

public java.util.ArrayList<Key<R,T>>[] getBackpointers()
Gets an array of lists of the backpointers for this ActiveArc. The array has length getDot() such that the array indices correspond to the source-side RHS constituents, which the backpointers refer to. The indices in each List correspond to the order in which backpointers were added; the lengths of the Lists in this array will often NOT be the same.

Returns:

getStartIndex

public int getStartIndex()
Gets the zero-based source-side input index where this ActiveArc begins.

Returns:
the start index

getEndIndex

public int getEndIndex()
Gets the zero-based source-side input index where this ActiveArc currently ends, given the dot position.

Returns:
the end index

public int getDot()
Gets the number of source-side RHS consituents that have been completed in this ActiveArc.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
A string representation of this ActiveArc that includes the source-side consituents that have been completed, a dot, and the source-side constituents that are still waiting to be completed along with the zero-based start and end indices for this arc.
